localString.value: Halfling forest druids are quick and loyal guardians of the wooded areas of Nordock
Fay Guardian Attire
Crafted by the halflings who guard Bria's Fay, this garment provides some magical protection and enhances the natural quickness of the wearer.
Fay Guardian Attire
Crafted by the halflings who guard Bria's Fay, this garment provides some magical protection and enhances the natural quickness of the wearer.
Halfling Attire
Traditional halfling attire, for those who would shun human customs such as boots or other shoes.
Wil the drag
Leaf Rustles
Twig Snaps
Halfling Store
Halfling Attire
Traditional halfling attire, for those who would shun human customs such as boots or other shoes.
Fay Guardian Attire
Crafted by the halflings who guard Bria's Fay, this garment provides some magical protection and enhances the natural quickness of the wearer.
Skinning Knife
This is a skinning knife. It is not very useful in combat but when used on a corpse can produce hide and meat. Rangers also use it to hunt.
This is a bedroll, to use it, drop it on the ground.
This is a bedroll. You can use it by placing it on the ground.
Broiled Spicy Greenfish

Greenfish are abundant in the seas that lap the coast of Nordock. While bland themselves, a concoction of pepper and other spices brings out a surprisingly tangy and pleasant flavor. This fish counts as a single food serving for resting purposes.
Bundle of Logs - 10 piece
This is a wrapped bundle of logs. It can be broken into seperate pieces with the "use" command.
Potion of Cure Light Wounds
Used as often in the peasant's home as the dungeon's dark, these simple concoctions are common throughout Faerun.
Potion of Cure Moderate Wounds
These curative potions are too expensive for most civilians, and are used almost exclusively by soldiers and adventurers.
Potion of Cure Serious Wounds
With the power to staunch the flow of blood or knit a broken bone, these potions are in common use among the dangerous professions.
Potion of Cure Critical Wounds
With the power to return people from the very brink of death, these potions do not come cheaply.
Acid Flask
A flask of acid that can be thrown at enemies.
Alchemist's Fire
Alchemist's Fire is a sticky, adhesive substance that ignites on contact with air.
Oil Flask
This is an oil flask. You may use it to refill a lantern, or try to light it and throw at someone
This is a standard lantern, you must refill it with oil every 6 hours of use.
This is a standard cheap disposable torch.
Tanglefoot Bag

This is a round leather bag full of alchemical goo. When you throw the bag against a creature, the bag comes apart and the goo bursts out, entangling the target and then becoming tough and resilient on exposure to air.
When this stone strikes a hard surface, it creates a deafening bang (a sonic attack).
New Area Transition
New Generic
Falnora Outpost
A banner - stitched and dyed - denoting a point of interest.
A portal glows softly before you. You wonder where it leads.
Place this object in any area where you want tracking to occur. Set Will to the DC of tracking in this area.
